column1: '''Old fat spider spinning in a tree!''' is a poem found within the chapter "[[Flies and Spiders]]" of ''[[The Hobbit]]''. [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]] uses this song to distract the [[spiders]] while attempting to save [[Thorin|Thorin]] and his [[Thorin and Company|companions]].
Old fat spider spinning in a tree!
Old fat spider can’t see me!
Stop your spinning and look for me!
You'll never catch me up your tree!
are weaving webs to wind me.
I am far more sweet than other meat
but still they cannot find me!
